examples.romaji: donna ni atsukutemo neru toki wa kuuraa o keshite neru.
examples.englishTranslation: No matter how hot it is, I always turn off the air-conditioner when I go to bed.

examples.japanese: あの人の名前はどんなに聞いても覚えられない。
examples.romaji: ano hito no namae wa donna ni kiitemo oboerarenai.
examples.englishTranslation: I can't remember that person's name no matter how many times I hear it..

examples.japanese: どんなに好きでも、それを伝えなければ始まらない。
examples.romaji: donna ni suki demo, sore o tsutae nakereba hajimaranai.
examples.englishTranslation: No matter how much you may like them, if you don't let them know nothing will ever start.

title: どうしても(doushitemo) - JLPT N3
explanationEN: no matter what; at any cost; after all ~

examples.japanese: 私はどうしても自分の家がほしい。
examples.romaji: watashi wa doushitemo jibun no ie ga hoshii.
examples.englishTranslation: I really want to have my own house (to the point I'd do anything).

examples.japanese: どうしても車が動かなかったので私たちは歩いて行くことにした。
examples.romaji: doushitemo kuruma ga ugokana katta no de watashi tachi wa aruite iku koto ni shita.
examples.englishTranslation: No matter what we tried the car wouldn't start, so finally we decided to go on foot.

examples.japanese: どうしても彼女の電話番号が思い出せない。
examples.romaji: doushitemo kanojo no denwa bangou ga omoi dasenai.
examples.englishTranslation: I can't for the life of me remember her phone number.

examples.japanese: 他の問題はできたのだが、この問題だけはどうしても解けない。
examples.romaji: hokano mondai wa dekita no daga, kono mondai dake wa doushitemo tokenai.
examples.englishTranslation: I was able to do the other problems, but this one I cannot solve no matter how hard I try.

examples.japanese: どうしても来られないときは連絡してください。
examples.romaji: doushitemo korarenai toki wa renraku shite kudasai.
examples.englishTranslation: Please contact me when you are not able to come.

title: ふりをする(furi o suru) - JLPT N3
titleRomaji: JLPT N3 Grammar furiwosuru (furi o suru )
explanationEN: to pretend; to act as if ~

examples.japanese: 彼は聞こえないふりをした。
examples.romaji: kare wa kikoenai furi o shita.
examples.englishTranslation: He pretended to not hear.

examples.japanese: 彼女は宿題をし終わったふりをしてテレビを見ている。
examples.romaji: kanojo wa shukudai o shiowatta furi o shite terebi o miteiru.
examples.englishTranslation: She pretended that she finished her homework and is watching TV.

examples.japanese: 分かったふりをしていたが、実はよく分からない。もう一度言ってください。
examples.romaji: wakatta furi o shiteita ga, jitsuwa yoku wakaranai. mou ichido itte kudasai.
examples.englishTranslation: I gave the impression that I understood, but I really didn't. Could you please say it once again?

examples.japanese: 彼はいつも人の話を全く聞かないのに、分かっているふりをしている。
examples.romaji: kare wa itsumo hito no hanashi o mattaku kikanai noni, wakatteiru furi o shiteiru.
examples.englishTranslation: Even though he never listens to anyone's stories, he always acts as if he understands.

examples.japanese: 知らないふりをしているけど本当は知っているでしょう？
examples.romaji: shiranai furi o shiteiru kedo hontou wa shitteiru deshou?
examples.englishTranslation: You're just pretending to not know, but really you do. Right?

examples.japanese: ふと街で彼に会った。
examples.romaji: futo machi de kare ni atta.
examples.englishTranslation: I met him in the street by chance.

examples.japanese: 学校に行く途中、ふと今日は母の誕生日だったことを思い出した。
examples.romaji: gakkou ni iku tochuu, futo kyou wa haha no tanjoubi datta koto o omoidashita.
examples.englishTranslation: On my way to school I suddenly remembered that today was my mother's birthday.

examples.japanese: 財布がないのにふと気がついた。
examples.romaji: saifu ga nai no ni futo ki ga tsuita.
examples.englishTranslation: He suddenly realized he had lost his wallet.

examples.japanese: 私はあの店で珍しいものをふと見つけた。
examples.romaji: watashi wa ano mise de mezurashii mono o futo mitsuketa.
examples.englishTranslation: I came across a rare item at that store.

examples.japanese: 素晴らしい考えがふと心に浮かんだ。
examples.romaji: subarashii kangae ga futo kokoro ni ukanda.
examples.englishTranslation: A brilliant idea just occurred to me.

title: がち(gachi) - JLPT N3
explanationEN: tend to; tendency to; frequently; often; to do something easily

examples.japanese: 私は、仕事でミスしがちです。
examples.romaji: watashi wa, shigoto de misu shi gachi desu.
examples.englishTranslation: I tend to make a lot of mistakes at work.

examples.japanese: 彼女は、学校をサボりがちです。
examples.romaji: kanojo wa, gakkou o sabori gachi desu.
examples.englishTranslation: She's always skipping school.

examples.japanese: ずっと曇りがちの天気が続いている。
examples.romaji: zutto kumori gachi no tenki ga tsuzuiteiru.
examples.englishTranslation: The constant cloudy weather keeps continuing.

examples.japanese: パソコンの使いすぎで目が疲れがちです。
examples.romaji: pasokon no tsukai sugi de me ga tsukare gachi desu.
examples.englishTranslation: My eyes tend to get tired from using computers too much.

examples.japanese: 一人暮らしなので、コンビニ弁当ばかり食べがちだ。
examples.romaji: hitorigurashi nano de, konbini bentou bakari tabe gachi da.
examples.englishTranslation: I live alone, so I tend to only eat meals from the convenience store.

examples.japanese: 信じがたいことだが、これは事実だ。
examples.romaji: shinji gatai koto daga, kore wa jijitsu da.
examples.englishTranslation: This may be hard to believe, but this is the truth.

examples.japanese: 許しがたいことです。
examples.romaji: yurushi gatai koto desu.
examples.englishTranslation: This is an unforgivable act.

examples.japanese: 彼の話は信じがたい内容でした。
examples.romaji: kare no hanashi wa shinji gatai naiyou deshita.
examples.englishTranslation: His story's contents were impossible to believe.

examples.japanese: 彼女は美人だから近寄りがたい。
examples.romaji: kanojo wa bijin dakara chikayori gatai.
examples.englishTranslation: She's so beautiful, It's impossible for me to approach her.

examples.japanese: 子どもに対する犯罪は許しがたい。
examples.romaji: kodomo ni tai suru hanzai wa yurushi gatai.
examples.englishTranslation: Crimes against children are unforgivable.

examples.japanese: 彼は人の名前を忘れ気味である。
examples.romaji: kare wa hito no namae o wasure gimi de aru.
examples.englishTranslation: He tends to forget people's names.

examples.japanese: 昨夜、彼は風邪気味だった。
examples.romaji: sakuya, kare wa kaze gimi datta.
examples.englishTranslation: He had a bit of a cold last night.

examples.japanese: 風邪気味で、熱っぽいんだ。
examples.romaji: kaze gimi de, netsu ppoi nda.
examples.englishTranslation: I feel like I'm catching a cold, and I'm a bit feverish.

examples.japanese: 残業続きで疲れ気味だ。
examples.romaji: zangyou tsuzuki de tsukare gimi da.
examples.englishTranslation: I'm feeling a bit tired due to continued overtime work.

examples.japanese: 新入社員は緊張気味の顔をしています。
examples.romaji: shinnyuu shain wa kinchou gimi no kao o shiteimasu.
examples.englishTranslation: The new employee looks a little bit nervous.

examples.japanese: バスは１０分ごとに通っている。
examples.romaji: basu wa 10 pun goto ni kayotteiru.
examples.englishTranslation: The buses run every 10 minutes.

examples.japanese: オリンピックは４年ごとに開催される。
examples.romaji: orinpikku wa yon nen goto ni kaisai sareru.
examples.englishTranslation: The Olympics are held every 4 years.

examples.japanese: 彼は6か月ごとに新作の小説を出している。
examples.romaji: kare wa 6 ka getsu goto ni shinsaku no shousetsu o dashiteiru.
examples.englishTranslation: He puts out a new short novel every 6 months.

examples.japanese: このフェリーは３０分ごとに通っている。
examples.romaji: kono ferii wa 30 pun goto ni kayotteiru.
examples.englishTranslation: This ferry runs every 30 minutes.

examples.japanese: 彼は土曜ごとに恋人に会っている。
examples.romaji: kare wa doyou goto ni koibito ni atteiru.
examples.englishTranslation: He meets his girlfriend on Saturdays.

examples.japanese: 君ほど美しい人はいません！
examples.romaji: kimi hodo utsukushii hito wa imasen.
examples.englishTranslation: There is no one that rivals your beauty.

examples.japanese: 死ぬほどのどがかわいている。
examples.romaji: shinu hodo nodo ga kawaiteiru.
examples.englishTranslation: I'm so thirsty I could die..

examples.japanese: 今年ほど雨の降った年はなかった。
examples.romaji: kotoshi hodo ame no futta toshi wa nakatta.
examples.englishTranslation: It rained more this year than any other year.

examples.japanese: 年をとるほど体が弱くなる。
examples.romaji: toshi o toru hodo karada ga yowaku naru.
examples.englishTranslation: My body becomes weaker as I grow older.

examples.japanese: ビックリするほど大きい赤ちゃん。
examples.romaji: bikkuri suru hodo ookii akachan.
examples.englishTranslation: The child was surprisingly large.

examples.japanese: 彼女ほど優しい人はいない。
examples.romaji: kanojo hodo yasashii hito wa inai.
examples.englishTranslation: There’s no one as kind as her.

examples.japanese: 英語の文法は日本語ほど難しくありません。
examples.romaji: eigo no bunpou wa nihongo hodo muzukashiku arimasen.
examples.englishTranslation: English grammar is not as difficult as Japanese grammar.

examples.japanese: 東京ほど家賃の高いところはない。
examples.romaji: toukyou hodo yachin no takai tokoro wa nai.
examples.englishTranslation: No city has higher rent than Tokyo.

examples.japanese: 私ほどあなたのことを大切に思っている人はいないだよ。
examples.romaji: watashi hodo anata no koto o taisetsu ni omotte iru hito wa inain da.
examples.englishTranslation: No one cares for you as much as I do.

examples.japanese: 彼ほど頭のいい人はいない。
examples.romaji: kare hodo atama no ii hito wa inai.
examples.englishTranslation: There is nobody as clever as he is.

examples.japanese: お金はいくらあっても困りません。
examples.romaji: okane wa ikura attemo komarimasen.
examples.englishTranslation: You can never have too much money.

examples.japanese: これはいくら安くても、買いたくない。
examples.romaji: kore wa ikura yasukutemo, kaitakunai.
examples.englishTranslation: No matter how cheap this is, I don't want to buy it.

examples.japanese: いくら調べても分からなかったので、先生に聞いた。
examples.romaji: ikura shirabetemo wakaranakatta node, sensei ni kiita.
examples.englishTranslation: I could not understand no matter how much I studied, so I asked my teacher.

examples.japanese: これは必要なので、いくら高くても買います。
examples.romaji: kore wa hitsuyou na node, ikura takakutemo kaimasu.
examples.englishTranslation: I need it so I’ll buy it now matter how expensive it is.

examples.japanese: いくら好きでも、それを伝えなければ始まらない。
examples.romaji: ikura suki demo, sore o tsutae nakereba hajimaranai.
examples.englishTranslation: No matter how much you may like them, if you don't let them know nothing will ever start.

title: 一方だ(ippou da) - JLPT N3
titleRomaji: JLPT N3 Grammar ippou da (ippou da )

examples.japanese: 最近、この町の人口は減る一方だ。
examples.romaji: saikin, kono machi no jinkou wa heru ippou da.
examples.englishTranslation: Recently, this town's population continues to decrease.

examples.japanese: 日本に来る外国人の数は増える一方だ。
examples.romaji: nihon ni kuru gaikokujin no kazu wa fueru ippou da.
examples.englishTranslation: The number of foreigners coming to Japan continues to increase.

examples.japanese: 交通事故は増える一方だ。
examples.romaji: koutsuu jiko wa fueru ippou da.
examples.englishTranslation: Traffic accidents are continuing to increase.

examples.japanese: 私は全然勉強していないので、成績は下がる一方だ。
examples.romaji: watashi wa zenzen benkyou shite inai node, seiseki wa sagaru ippou da.
examples.englishTranslation: I never study and so my grades just keep dropping.

examples.japanese: 日本の人口はこのままだと減少する一方だと思います。
examples.romaji: nihon no jinkou wa kono mama da to genshou suru ippou da to omoimasu.
examples.englishTranslation: With Japan's population situation as it is, I think it will just continue to decline.

title: 一体(ittai) - JLPT N3
explanationEN: emphasis; what on earth; what in the world

examples.japanese: 一体どこで彼に会ったんだ。
examples.romaji: ittai doko de kare ni atta nda.
examples.englishTranslation: Where on earth did you meet him?

examples.japanese: あなたは一体何をしていますか？
examples.romaji: anata wa ittai nani o shite imasu ka?
examples.englishTranslation: What exactly are you doing?

examples.japanese: あの人は一体何の者だ？
examples.romaji: ano hito wa ittai nan no mono da?
examples.englishTranslation: Who in the world is that?

examples.japanese: 彼女は一体どこに住んでいるだろう。
examples.romaji: kanojo wa ittai doko ni sunde iru darou.
examples.englishTranslation: Where in the world does she live?

examples.japanese: 一体誰が彼女にそんなことを言ったのか？
examples.romaji: ittai dare ga kanojo ni sonna koto o itta no ka?
examples.englishTranslation: Who could have said such a thing to her?

title: じゃない(janai) - JLPT N3
explanationEN: maybe; most likely; confirmation of information; express surprise towards listener

examples.japanese: トムさんも来るじゃない？
examples.romaji: tomu san mo kuru janai?
examples.englishTranslation: Tom will surely come as well?

examples.japanese: あそこにいる人って、田中先生じゃない？
examples.romaji: asoko ni iru hito tte, tanaka sensei janai?
examples.englishTranslation: Isn't that person over there Mr. Tanaka?

examples.japanese: やればできるじゃない。
examples.romaji: yareba dekiru janai.
examples.englishTranslation: I didn't think you had it in you.

examples.japanese: 彼は今度も来ないんじゃないかな。
examples.romaji: kare wa kondo mo konai n janai kana.
examples.englishTranslation: I don't think he'll come this time either.

examples.japanese: ちょっと！危ないじゃない。
examples.romaji: chotto! abunai janai.
examples.englishTranslation: Be careful, that's dangerous!

title: か何か(ka nani ka) - JLPT N3
titleRomaji: JLPT N3 Grammar ka nanika (ka nani ka )

examples.japanese: 彼は病気か何かだろう。
examples.romaji: kare wa byouki ka nani ka darou.
examples.englishTranslation: He must be sick or something.

examples.japanese: オレンジジュースか何か欲しいな。
examples.romaji: orenji juusu ka nani ka hoshii na.
examples.englishTranslation: I want some orange juice or something.

examples.japanese: 私はアイスクリームか何か食べたいです。
examples.romaji: watashi wa aisu kuriimu ka nani ka tabetai desu.
examples.englishTranslation: I want to eat ice cream or something.

examples.japanese: 帰りは寒いから上着か何か持っていった方がいいよ 。
examples.romaji: kaeri wa samui kara uwagi ka nani ka motte itta hou ga ii yo.
examples.englishTranslation: It will be cold when you come back, so you'd best bring a jacket or something.

examples.japanese: 昼ご飯はサンドイッチか何かを作ってあげましょうか。
examples.romaji: hiru gohan wa sandoicchi ka nani ka tsukutte agemashou ka.
examples.englishTranslation: I'll fix a sandwich or something for your lunch?

title: かける(kakeru) - JLPT N3
explanationEN: half-; not yet finished; in the middle of~

examples.japanese: お風呂に入りかけたときに電話が鳴った。
examples.romaji: ofuro ni hairi kaketa toki ni denwa ga natta.
examples.englishTranslation: The phone rang when I was about to get in the bath.

examples.japanese: この本はまだ読みかけだ。
examples.romaji: kono hon wa mada yomikake da.
examples.englishTranslation: I haven’t finished this book yet.

examples.japanese: テーブルの上に食べかけのケーキが置いてある。
examples.romaji: teeburu no ue ni tabe kake no keeki ga oitearu.
examples.englishTranslation: The half-finished cake is put on the table.

examples.japanese: 彼は何か大事そうなことを言いかけて、やめてしまった。
examples.romaji: kare wa nani ka daiji souna koto o ii kakete, yamete shimatta.
examples.englishTranslation: He stopped in the middle of saying something that sounded important.

examples.japanese: 彼女へのラブレターを書いたが、ポストに入れかけて、やっぱりやめた。
examples.romaji: kanojo e no raburetaa o kaitaga, posuto ni ire kakete, yappari yameta.
examples.englishTranslation: I wrote a love letter for her and was halfway to putting it in the post before I changed my mind.

title: から〜にかけて(kara~ni kakete) - JLPT N3
titleRomaji: JLPT N3 Grammar kara ~ nikakete (kara~ni kakete )

examples.japanese: 東京から京都にかけて新幹線で行くのは何時間かかるの？
examples.romaji: toukyou kara kyouto ni kakete shinkansen de iku no wa nan jikan kakaru no?
examples.englishTranslation: How long does it take to get from Tokyo to Kyoto by bullet train?

examples.japanese: 午前から夕方にかけて昼寝をした。
examples.romaji: gozen kara yuugata ni kakete hirune o shita.
examples.englishTranslation: I took a nap from morning until evening.

examples.japanese: 日本では、大学の入学試験は、普通２月から３月にかけて行われる。
examples.romaji: nihon dewa, daigaku no nyuugaku shiken wa, futsuu nigatsu kara sangatsu ni kakete okonawareru.
examples.englishTranslation: In Japan, university entrance exam is usually held from February to March.

examples.japanese: 明日は昼から夕方にかけて雨でしょう。
examples.romaji: ashita wa hiru kara yuugata ni kakete ame deshou.
examples.englishTranslation: Tomorrow it will rain from noon through late afternoon.

examples.japanese: 六月から七月にかけて、日本は梅雨のシーズンです。
examples.romaji: 6 gatsu kara 7gatsu ni kakete, nihon wa tsuyu no shiizun desu.
examples.englishTranslation: From June to July is Japan's rainy season.

title: 代わりに(kawari ni) - JLPT N3
titleRomaji: JLPT N3 Grammar kawari ni (kawari ni )
explanationEN: instead of; as a substitute for​; in exchange for; in return for

examples.japanese: 私が部長の代わりに出張に行きます。
examples.romaji: watashi ga buchou no kawari ni shucchou ni ikimasu.
examples.englishTranslation: I will go on a business trip on behalf of my manager.

examples.japanese: 今朝はコーヒーの代わりにお茶を飲んだ。
examples.romaji: kesa wa koohii no kawari ni ocha o nonda.
examples.englishTranslation: This morning, I drank tea instead of coffee.

examples.japanese: 昨日残業した代わりに、今日は少し早く帰っていいと言われた。
examples.romaji: kinou zangyou shita kawari ni, kyou wa sukoshi hayaku kaette ii to iwareta.
examples.englishTranslation: In exchange for working overtime yesterday, I was told I could leave a little earlier today.

examples.japanese: 今日は仕事へ車で行く代わりに自転車で行った。
examples.romaji: kyou wa shigoto e iku kawari ni jitensha de itta.
examples.englishTranslation: Today, instead of going to work by car, I went by bicycle.

examples.japanese: お箸がないので、その代わりにフォークを使う。
examples.romaji: ohashi ga nai no de, sono kawari ni fooku o tsukau.
examples.englishTranslation: Since I do not have any chopsticks, I will use a fork instead

title: 結局(kekkyoku) - JLPT N3
explanationEN: after all; eventually; in the end ~

examples.japanese: 結局彼はそれを買わなかった。
examples.romaji: kekkyoku kare wa sore o kawanakatta.
examples.englishTranslation: He didn't buy it in the end.

examples.japanese: 友人から何度も誘われたが、結局行かないことにした。
examples.romaji: yuujin kara nando mo sasowareta ga, kekkyoku ikanai koto ni shita.
examples.englishTranslation: I was invited by my good friend countless times, but ultimately decided not to go.

examples.japanese: 私たちは結局この試合に負けてしまった。
examples.romaji: watashitachi wa kekkyoku kono shiai ni makete shimatta.
examples.englishTranslation: In the end, we lost this match.

examples.japanese: 彼は働きすぎて、結局は病気になってしまった。
examples.romaji: kare wa hatarakisugite, kekkyoku wa byouki ni natte shimatta.
examples.englishTranslation: He worked so hard that eventually he made himself ill.

examples.japanese: お昼は何を食べようかと考えていたけど、結局ハンバーガーにした。
examples.romaji: ohiru wa nani o tabeyou ka to kangaeteita kedo, kekkyoku hanbaagaa ni shita.
examples.englishTranslation: I was thinking about what I should eat for lunch, but ended up getting a hamburger.

title: あげく(ageku) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: to end up; in the end; finally; after all ~

examples.japanese: 2時間も待たされたあげく、結局に試合は延期になった。
examples.romaji: 2 jikan mo matasareta ageku, keekyoku ni shiai wa enki ni natta.
examples.englishTranslation: After waiting for 2 hours, the match ended up being postponed.

examples.japanese: 毎日の残業のあげく、彼女は倒れて入院することになりました。
examples.romaji: mainichi no zangyou no ageku, kanojo wa taorete nyuuin shita koto ni nari mashita.
examples.englishTranslation: After working overtime everyday, she collapsed and was hospitalized.

examples.japanese: 人気のラーメン店に２時間も並んだあげく、売り切れで食べられなかった。
examples.romaji: ninki no raamen mise ni 2 jikan mo naranda ageku, urikire de taberarena katta.
examples.englishTranslation: After waiting at the popular ramen shop for 2 hours, they ended up sold out and I couldn't eat anything.

examples.japanese: どの大学に入ろうかと、さんざん悩んだあげく、京都大学に決めた。
examples.romaji: dono daigaku ni hairou ka to, sanzan nayanda ageku, kyouto daigaku ni kimeta.
examples.englishTranslation: After thinking it over carefully about which university to enter, I decided on Kyoto University.

examples.japanese: 彼らは夫婦げんかを繰り返したあげく、とうとう離婚した。
examples.romaji: karera wa fuufu genka o kurikaeshita ageku, toutou rikon shita.
examples.englishTranslation: After fighting countless times, they finally got a divorce.

examples.japanese: 今日中にファックス、あるいは、メールで送ってください。
examples.romaji: kyoujuu ni fakkusu, aruiwa meeru de okutte kudasai.
examples.englishTranslation: Please send it today via fax or mail.

examples.japanese: ご注文は電話か、あるいはインターネットでお願いします。
examples.romaji: gochuumon wa, aruiwa intaanetto de onegai shimasu.
examples.englishTranslation: Please order either by phone or online.

examples.japanese: 来週の火曜日の午後はどうですか。あるいは水曜日の午前でも構いませんが．．．
examples.romaji: raishuu no kayoubi no gogo wa dou desuka. aruiwa suiyoubi no gozen demo kamai masen ga…
examples.englishTranslation: How about Tuesday afternoon next week? Or Wednesday morning also works.

examples.japanese: 進学するか、あるいは就職するか私は迷っています。
examples.romaji: shingaku suru ka, aruiwa shuushoku suru ka watashi wa mayotte imaus.
examples.englishTranslation: I'm not sure whether I should advance my education or start working.

examples.japanese: あるいはそれは本当かもしれない。
examples.romaji: aruiwa sore wa hontou kamoshirenai.
examples.englishTranslation: Perhaps that's true.

title: ばかりか(bakari ka) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: not only... but also; as well as ~

examples.japanese: このマンションは狭いばかりか、暗いです。
examples.romaji: kono manshon wa semai bakari ka, kurai desu.
examples.englishTranslation: This apartment is not only very small, it's also quite dark.

examples.japanese: 私は、漢字ばかりか、ひらがなもカタカナも書けません。
examples.romaji: watashi wa, kanji bakarika, hiragana mo katakana mo kakemasen.
examples.englishTranslation: Not only can I not write kanji, but I can't even write hiragana or katakana.

examples.japanese: このレストランは、味が悪いばかりか、店員の態度も悪い。
examples.romaji: kono resutoran wa, aji ga warui bakari ka, tenin no taido mo warui.
examples.englishTranslation: Not only is this restaurant's food bad, but the service is also horrible.

examples.japanese: 花子さんはスポーツが上手なばかりか、成績も優秀である。
examples.romaji: hanako san wa supootsu ga jouzu na bakari ka, seiseki mo yuushuu de aru.
examples.englishTranslation: Hanako is not only good at sports, but she also has excellent grades.

examples.japanese: うちの子は7歳なのに日本語ばかりか英語まで喋れるよ。
examples.romaji: uchi no ko wa 7 sai nano ni nihongo bakari ka eigo made shabereru yo!
examples.englishTranslation: Although our child is only 7, they can speak not only Japanese, but English as well.

title: ばかりに(bakari ni) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: simply because; on account of~ (negative result)

examples.japanese: お金がないばかりに、今度の旅行に行けなかった。
examples.romaji: okane ga nai bakari ni, kondo no ryokou ni ikenakatta.
examples.englishTranslation: I wasn't able to go on this trip since I don't have any money.

examples.japanese: ホラー映画を見たばかりに、怖くてなかなか寝られない。
examples.romaji: horaa eiga o mita bakari ni, kowakute nakanaka nerarenai.
examples.englishTranslation: I watched a horror movie, which was really scary and now I can't seem to fall asleep.

examples.japanese: 先輩のアドバイスを聞き入れなかったばかりに大きな失敗をしてしまった。
examples.romaji: senpai no adobaisu o kiki irenakatta bakari ni ooki na shippai o shite shimatta.
examples.englishTranslation: I didn't listen to the advice of my senior and ended up making a huge mistake.

examples.japanese: 彼の一言を信じたばかりにひどい目にあった。
examples.romaji: kare no hitokoto o shinjita bakari ni hidoime ni atta.
examples.englishTranslation: I had a horrible experience all because I believed what he said.

examples.japanese: 経験がないばかりに苦労した。
examples.romaji: keiken ga nai bakari ni kurou shita.
examples.englishTranslation: I suffered since I lacked any experience.

title: ちなみに(chinamini) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: by the way; in this connection; incidentally; (conjunction)

examples.japanese: これ、お土産だよ。ちなみにベトナムで買ったんだよ。
examples.romaji: kore, omiyage da yo. chinamini betonamu de katta nda yo.
examples.englishTranslation: Here is a souvenir. I bought it in Vietnam by the way.

examples.japanese: ちなみに、私のことを覚えていますか？
examples.romaji: chinamini, watashi no koto o oboete imasu ka?
examples.englishTranslation: By the way, do you remember me?

examples.japanese: ちなみに、私は刺身と寿司は好きではない。
examples.romaji: chinamini, watashi wa sashimi to sushi wa suki dewa nai.
examples.englishTranslation: Incidentally, I do not like sashimi or sushi.

examples.japanese: N2に合格したよ！ちなみに満点だったよ！
examples.romaji: N2 ni goukaku shita yo! chinamini manten datta yo!
examples.englishTranslation: I passed the N2! And by the way, I got a full score!

examples.japanese: ちなみに、私の日本語が間違ってたら遠慮なく言ってください。
examples.romaji: chinamini, watashi no nihongo ga machigatte tarae enryo naku itte kudasai.
examples.englishTranslation: By the way, please feel free to tell me if my Japanese is wrong.

title: ちっとも～ない(chitto mo~nai) - JLPT N2
titleRomaji: JLPT N2 Grammar chittomo ~ nai (chitto mo~nai )

examples.japanese: 彼は酒はちっとも飲まない。
examples.romaji: kare wa sake wa chitto mo nomanai.
examples.englishTranslation: He doesn't drink any alcohol at all.

examples.japanese: この商品はちっとも売れない。
examples.romaji: kono shouhin wa chitto mo urenai.
examples.englishTranslation: This product does not sell at all.

examples.japanese: 俺の妻は英語をちっとも知らない。彼女は日本語しか話せない。
examples.romaji: ore no tsuma wa eigo o chitto mo shiranai. kanojo wa nihongo shika hanasenai.
examples.englishTranslation: My wife doesn't know any English. She only speaks Japanese.

examples.japanese: 彼は父親の言うことをちっとも聞かない。
examples.romaji: kare wa chichioya no iukoto o chitto mo kikanai.
examples.englishTranslation: He doesn't listen to anything his father says.

examples.japanese: 彼は女の子の気持なんかちっともわからない。
examples.romaji: kare wa onna no ko no kimochi nanka chitto mo wakarai.
examples.englishTranslation: He doesn't understand the feelings of young women one bit.

title: だけあって(dake atte) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: being the case; precisely because; as expected from ~

examples.japanese: このアパートは駅に近いだけあって、やっぱり家賃も高い。
examples.romaji: kono apaato wa eki ni chikai dake atte, yappari yachin ga takai.
examples.englishTranslation: This apartment is close to the station, so as expected the rent is expensive.

examples.japanese: さすが大都会だけあって何かしら仕事がある。
examples.romaji: sasuga daitokai dake atte nanika shira shigoto ga aru.
examples.englishTranslation: As expected of a big city, there is always work to do.

examples.japanese: 料理教室に通っているだけあって、彼女の作る料理はとても美味しい。
examples.romaji: ryouri kyoushitsu ni kayotte iru dake atte, kanojo no tsukuru ryouri wa totemo oishii.
examples.englishTranslation: She is taking lessons at a cooking school and so the food she makes is really delicious.

examples.japanese: このバッグは安いだけあってすぐに壊れてしまった。
examples.romaji: kono baggu wa yasui dake atte sugu ni kowarete shimatta.
examples.englishTranslation: As expected of this cheap bag, it broke right away.

examples.japanese: この場所は有名なだけあって、たくさんの観光客がいる。
examples.romaji: kono basho wa yuumei na dake atte, takusan no kankoukyaku ga iru.
examples.englishTranslation: This is a very famous place and so there are lots of tourists.

title: だけに(dake ni) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: being the case; precisely because; as one would expect

examples.japanese: 駅が近いだけに家賃も高い。
examples.romaji: eki ga chikai dake ni yachin mo takai.
examples.englishTranslation: The station is nearby, which is also why the rent is so high.

examples.japanese: このホテルは５つ星ホテルなだけに、サービスが充実している。
examples.romaji: kono hoteru wa itsutsu boshi hoteru na dake ni, saabisu ga juujitsu shite iru.
examples.englishTranslation: As one would expect of a 5-star hotel, the service is perfect.

examples.japanese: 彼女は日本語を20年教えているだけに、教え方がとても上手だ。
examples.romaji: kanojo wa nihongo o 20 nen oshiete iru dake ni, oshiekata ga totemo jouzu da.
examples.englishTranslation: As expected of someone who has taught Japanese for 20 years, her teaching style is very good.

examples.japanese: 田中さんは小学校の時にアメリカで生活していただけに、英語の発音はネイティブのようだ。
examples.romaji: tanaka san wa shougakkou no toki ni amerika de seikatsu shiteita dake ni, eigo no hatsuon wa neitibu no you da.
examples.englishTranslation: Tanaka spent his elementary school days in America, and as one would expect his English pronunciation is just like a native.

examples.japanese: 試験のために一生懸命勉強しただけに、不合格のショックは大きかった。
examples.romaji: shiken no tame ni isshoukenmei benkyou shita dake ni, fugoukaku no shokku wa ookikatta.
examples.englishTranslation: I studied very hard for the exam, so I was really shocked when I heard that I failed.

title: だって(datte) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: because; but; after all; even; too

examples.japanese: 彼だって人間だ。
examples.romaji: kare datte ningen da.
examples.englishTranslation: He is only human.

examples.japanese: 私だってあなたに会いたい。
examples.romaji: watashi datte anata ni aitai.
examples.englishTranslation: I miss you too.

examples.japanese: 誰だってそんなことは知っているさ。
examples.romaji: dare datte sonna koto wa shitteiru sa.
examples.englishTranslation: Everybody knows that.

examples.japanese: 私だって本くらい読むよ。
examples.romaji: watashi datte hon kurai yomu yo.
examples.englishTranslation: Even I read books every once in a while.

examples.japanese: 「何を怒ってるの？」「だって、約束を破ったじゃん。』
examples.romaji: 「nani o okotteru no?」「datte, yakusoku o yabutta jan.」
examples.englishTranslation: "Why are you upset?""Because you broke your promise!"

title: どころではない(dokoro dewa nai) - JLPT N2
titleRomaji: JLPT N2 Grammar dokorodehanai (dokoro dewa nai )
explanationEN: not the time for; not the place for; far from; anything but ~

examples.japanese: 彼はよく間違いをするが、バカどころではない。
examples.romaji: kare wa yoku machigai o suru ga, baka dokoro dewa nai.
examples.englishTranslation: He often makes mistakes, but he is no fool.

examples.japanese: 宿題がたくさんあってテレビを見るどころではない。
examples.romaji: shukudai ga takusan atte terebi o miru dokoro dewa nai.
examples.englishTranslation: There's a bunch of homework to do, this is no time to be watching TV.

examples.japanese: 風邪がひどくて、遊びに行くどころじゃない。
examples.romaji: kaze ga hidokute, asobi ni iku doroko janai.
examples.englishTranslation: I have a bad cold and can't even think about going out right now.

examples.japanese: 彼女はケーキ屋で働いているから、毎年クリスマスは彼氏とデートどころではない。
examples.romaji: kanojo wa keekiya de hataraite iru kara, maitoshi kurisumasu wa kanojo to deeto dokoro dewa nai.
examples.englishTranslation: She works at a cake shop so every year on Christmas she has no time to go on a date with her boyfriend.

examples.japanese: 他人の仕事を手伝うどころではありません。自分の仕事も間に合わないんです。
examples.romaji: tanin no shigoto o tetsudau dokoro dewa arimasen. jibun no shigoto mo mani awanain desu.
examples.englishTranslation: There is no time to be helping other people with their work. You'll end up being late with your own work.

title: どころか(dokoro ka) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: far from; anything but; let alone; not to mention; much less ~

examples.japanese: もっと勉強しないと、N2どころかN3も無理だ。
examples.romaji: motto benkyou shinaito, N2 dokoro ka N3 mo muri da.
examples.englishTranslation: If you do not study more, you will not be able to pass N2, let alone N3.

examples.japanese: そんな食べ物、健康になるどころか、病気になっちゃうよ。
examples.romaji: sonna tabemono, kenkou ni naru dokoro ka, byouki ni nacchau yo.
examples.englishTranslation: That food isn't going to make you healthy, on the contrary it will make you sick.

examples.japanese: 「夏休みは取れそう？」「忙しくて夏休みどころか日曜日も休めない。」
examples.romaji: 「natsu yasumi wa toresou？」「isogashikute natsu yasumi dokoro ka nichiyoubi mo yasumeni.」
examples.englishTranslation: "Does it look like you can take summer break off?""I'm so busy I won't be able to take a summer break, much less even a Sunday off."

examples.japanese: 医者に出された薬を飲んでいるのに、よくなるどころか、症状はひどくなる一方だよ。
examples.romaji: isha ni dasareta kusuri o nondeiru noni, yoku naru dokoro ka, shoujou ga hidoku naru ippou da yo.
examples.englishTranslation: Even though I'm taking the medicine my doctor gave me, I am not getting better. On the contrary, my symptoms keep getting worse.

examples.japanese: 私は彼に役に立つどころか、迷惑もかけた。
examples.romaji: watashi wa kare ni yaku ni tatsu dokoro ka, meiwaku mo kaketa.
examples.englishTranslation: I was far from being of any help to him. Rather I got in his way.

title: どうやら(dou yara) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: possibly; apparently; seems like; somehow; barely ~

examples.japanese: どうやら明日は雨になりそうだ。
examples.romaji: dou yara ashita wa ame ni nari sou da.
examples.englishTranslation: Apparently, it's going to rain tomorrow.

examples.japanese: どうやら、彼は知らないらしい。
examples.romaji: dou yara, kare wa shiranai rashii.
examples.englishTranslation: It seems he doesn’t know.

examples.japanese: どうやら誤解があるようだ。
examples.romaji: dou yara gokai ga aru you da.
examples.englishTranslation: There appears to be a misunderstanding.

examples.japanese: 今晩はどうやら雪が降りそうだ。
examples.romaji: konban wa dou yara yuki ga furi sou da.
examples.englishTranslation: Apparently, it is going to snow tonight.

examples.japanese: どうやら日本の生活になれてきた。
examples.romaji: dou yara nihon no seikatsu ni narete kita.
examples.englishTranslation: Somehow, I finally started getting used to life in Japan.

title: どうせ(douse) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: anyhow; in any case; at any rate; after all; no matter what

examples.japanese: どうせやるなら上手にやれ。
examples.romaji: douse yaru nara jouzu ni yare.
examples.englishTranslation: If you're going to do it no matter what, do it well!

examples.japanese: どうせ行くんでしょ。
examples.romaji: douse iku n desho.
examples.englishTranslation: I daresay you are going to go no matter what.

examples.japanese: どうせ参加しないのなら、早めに伝えたほうがいい。
examples.romaji: douse sanka shinai no nara, hayame ni tsutaeta houga ii.
examples.englishTranslation: If you're not going to participate after all, it's best to say so as quick as possible.

examples.japanese: どうせ、試合の前にまだ一週間があるのでもっと練習しょう。
examples.romaji: douse, shiai no mae ni mada isshukan ga aru node motto renshuu shiyou.
examples.englishTranslation: Anyway, we still have a week to go before the game so let's practice some more.

examples.japanese: 今から行ってもどうせ遅刻だから、行かないことにする。
examples.romaji: ima kara itte mo douse chikoku dakara, ikanai koto ni suru.
examples.englishTranslation: Even if I go now I will be late anyway, so I decided not to go.

title: 得ない(enai) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: unable to; cannot; it is not possible to ~

examples.japanese: あの人が結婚したって本当！？え～！あり得ないよ！
examples.romaji: ano hito ga kekkon shitatte hontou! ? e~! ari enai yo!
examples.englishTranslation: Is it true that he got married? No way! It's not possible!

examples.japanese: あの真面目な彼が犯人？そんなことはあり得ない。
examples.romaji: ano majime na kare ga hannin? sonna koto wa ari enai.
examples.englishTranslation: You think someone as earnest as him is the culprit? That's unbelievable..

examples.japanese: 地震がいつ来るかなんて、予測し得ないことだ。
examples.romaji: jishin ga itsu kuru ka nante, yosoku shi enai kotoda.
examples.englishTranslation: It is unpredictable when an earthquake will occur.

examples.japanese: 無から有は生じ得ない。
examples.romaji: mu kara yuu wa shouji enai.
examples.englishTranslation: Nothing can come of nothing.

examples.japanese: 機械は完全には人力に代わり得ない。
examples.romaji: kikai wa kanzen ni wa jinriki ni kawari enai.
examples.englishTranslation: Machinery cannot completely take the place of human labor.

title: 得る(eru / uru) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: can; to be able to; is possible to ~

examples.japanese: 君の話を信じるよ。だってこの世界ではどんなことでも起こり得るから。
examples.romaji: kimi no hanashi o shinjiru yo. datte kono sekaide wa donna koto demo okori eru kara.
examples.englishTranslation: I believe in your story. I mean, anything is possible in this world.

examples.japanese: 事故はいつでも起こり得るので、気をつけてください。
examples.romaji: jiko wa itsu demo okori eru node, ki o tsukete kudasai.
examples.englishTranslation: Accidents can happen at any time, so please be careful!

examples.japanese: タバコを吸いすぎや、お酒を飲み過ぎは病気の原因になり得ます。
examples.romaji: tabako o sui sugi ya, o sake o nomi sugi wa byouki no genin ni nari emasu.
examples.englishTranslation: Excessive smoking and drinking too much alcohol can cause illness.

examples.japanese: 運動不足は病気の原因になり得るので、できるだけ体を動かすようにしてください。
examples.romaji: undou fusoku wa byouki no genin ni nari eru node, dekiru dake karada o ugokasu youni shite kudasai.
examples.englishTranslation: Lack of exercise can cause illness, so try to move as much as you can.

examples.japanese: この不況では大手企業の倒産もあり得る。
examples.romaji: kono fukyou dewa ootekigyou no tousan mo ariuru.
examples.englishTranslation: In this recession, it's possible some major companies may go bankrupt.

examples.japanese: 来週の月曜日からレッスンを再び開始したいですか？
examples.romaji: raishuu no getsuyoubi kara ressun o futatabi kaishi shitai desu ka?
examples.englishTranslation: Would you like to restart your lessons from next Monday?

examples.japanese: 今年の旅行は楽しかった。来年の冬再びここに来たい。
examples.romaji: kotoshi no ryokou wa tanoshikatta. rainen no fuyu futatabi koko ni kitai.
examples.englishTranslation: This year's trip was fun. I want to come here again next winter.

examples.japanese: 10年後にようやく彼は、再び故郷の町を見た。
examples.romaji: 10 nengo ni youyaku kare wa, futatabi kokyou no machi o mita.
examples.englishTranslation: He finally saw his hometown again after ten years.

examples.japanese: 昨日私は、図書館で１ヶ月前に出会った少女と再び会った。
examples.romaji: kinou watashi wa, toshokan de ikkagetsu mae ni deatta shoujo to futatabi atta.
examples.englishTranslation: Yesterday I once again met the girl whom I met in the library a month ago.

examples.japanese: 本当に最悪の男だ。二度と再びあの男とは会いたくない。
examples.romaji: hontou ni saiaku no otoko da. nido to futatabi ano otoko to wa aitakunai.
examples.englishTranslation: He really is the worst guy... I don't ever want to see him again.

title: がきっかけで / をきっかけに(ga kikkake de / o kikkake ni) - JLPT N2
titleRomaji: JLPT N2 Grammar gakikkakede  /  wokikkakeni (ga kikkake de / o kikkake ni )
explanationEN: with… as a start; as a result of; taking advantage of ~

examples.japanese: 彼女は病気をきっかけにそのつまらない仕事を辞めた。
examples.romaji: kanojo wa byouki o kikkake ni sono tsumaranai shigoto o yameta.
examples.englishTranslation: She used her illness to quit that boring job.

examples.japanese: 昨年の事故をきっかけとして、安全対策が強化された。
examples.romaji: sakunen no jiko o kikkake toshite, anzentaisaku ga kyouka sareta.
examples.englishTranslation: As a result of last year's accident, safety measures have been strengthened.

examples.japanese: 子供が生まれたのをきっかけとして、タバコを辞めた。
examples.romaji: kodomo ga umareta no o kikkake to shite, tabako o yameta.
examples.englishTranslation: As a result of my child being born, I quit smoking.

examples.japanese: パソコンを買ってもらったことがきっかけで、プログラミングの勉強を始めました。
examples.romaji: pasokon o katte moratta koto ga kikkake de, puroguramingu no benkyou o hajime mashita.
examples.englishTranslation: Taking advantage of the computer I received, I began studying programming.

examples.japanese: 失恋をきっかけに、海外に出て仕事をしようと決心した。
examples.romaji: shitsuren o kikkake ni, kaigai ni dete shigoto o shiyou to kesshin shita.
examples.englishTranslation: After experiencing heartbreak, I decided to move and work abroad.

title: げ(ge) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: looks like; seems like; appears to ~

examples.japanese: 何か、言いたげだね。
examples.romaji: nanika, iita ge da ne.
examples.englishTranslation: They look like they want to say something.

examples.japanese: あの人は寂しげな目をしている。
examples.romaji: ano hito wa sabishige na me o shiteiru.
examples.englishTranslation: That person has a lonely look in their eyes

examples.japanese: 彼は眠たげな声でおはようと言った。
examples.romaji: kare wa nemuta ge na koe de ohayou to itta.
examples.englishTranslation: He said good morning with a sleepy voice.

examples.japanese: ずいぶん、自信ありげだね。
examples.romaji: zuibun, jishin ari ge da ne.
examples.englishTranslation: You seem very confident.

examples.japanese: 一人暮らしのために家を出る日、母は少し寂しげだった。
examples.romaji: hitori gurashi no tame ni ie o deru hi, haha wa sukoshi sabishi ge datta.
examples.englishTranslation: My mother looked a little sad on the day I moved out to live by myself.

examples.japanese: 娘はスポーツが好きだが、逆に息子はスポーツが嫌いだ。
examples.romaji: musume wa supootsu ga suki da ga, gyaku ni musuko wa supootsu ga kirai da.
examples.englishTranslation: My daughter likes sports, but on the other hand my son hates them.

examples.japanese: 天気予報と逆に、雨が降り続いている。
examples.romaji: tenki yohou to gyaku ni, ame ga furitsuzuite iru.
examples.englishTranslation: It’s been raining nonstop in contrast to the weather forecast.

examples.japanese: 彼はゲームが大好きだが、逆に弟さんは嫌いだ。
examples.romaji: kare wa geemu ga daisuki daga, gyaku ni otouto san wa kirai da.
examples.englishTranslation: He loves to play games, but contrarily his younger brother dislikes them.

examples.japanese: 逆に、嫌いな日本の料理はなんですか？
examples.romaji: gyaku ni, kirai na nihon no ryouri wa nan desu ka?
examples.englishTranslation: On the other hand, what is a Japanese food that you hate?

examples.japanese: 私達の期待とは逆に、今年の売り上げは増えなかった。
examples.romaji: watashitachi no kitai to wa gyaku ni, kotoshi no uriage wa fuenakatta.
examples.englishTranslation: Contrary to our expectations, sales did not increase this year.

title: 反面(hanmen) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: while, although; on the other hand~

examples.japanese: この部屋は日当たりがいい反面、夏はかなり暑いです。
examples.romaji: kono heya wa hiatari ga ii hanmen, natsu wa kanari atsui desu.
examples.englishTranslation: This room has great light exposure, but on the other hand it is very hot in the summer.

examples.japanese: 子供の成長は嬉しい反面、どこか寂しい。
examples.romaji: kodomo no seichou wa ureshii hanmen, dokoka sabishii.
examples.englishTranslation: I'm happy to see my children grow, but on the other hand I am a little bit sad.

examples.japanese: 彼氏ができたら、楽しい反面、一人の時間がすくなくなりました。
examples.romaji: kareshi ga dekitara, tanoshii hanmen, hitori no jikan ga sukunaku narimashita.
examples.englishTranslation: I'm happy to have a boyfriend, but on the other hand my time for myself has considerably dropped.

examples.japanese: 一人暮らしは楽しい反面、一緒に話す相手がいないので寂しいこともあります。
examples.romaji: hitori gurashi wa tanoshii hanmen, issho ni hanasu aite ga inai node sabishii koto mo arimasu.
examples.englishTranslation: Living alone is enjoyable, but on the other hand it can sometimes be a little lonely not having someone to talk to.

examples.japanese: 子供にとって、インターネットは便利な反面、悪い影響を与えることもあります。
examples.romaji: kodomo ni totte, intaanetto wa benri na hanmen, warui eikyou o ataeru koto mo arimasu.
examples.englishTranslation: For children, on one hand the inernet is very convenient, but there are also some negative effects as well.

title: 一応(ichiou) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: more or less; pretty much; roughly; tentatively ~

examples.japanese: 一応やりました。
examples.romaji: ichiou yarimashita.
examples.englishTranslation: I did it (but it may still need some work).

examples.japanese: 一応やってみます。
examples.romaji: ichiou yatte miru.
examples.englishTranslation: (I may not be able to do it well, but) I will give it a shot.

examples.japanese: 一応、付き合っている人がいるんだ。
examples.romaji: ichiou, tsukiatteiru hito ga iru nda.
examples.englishTranslation: I am sort of seeing someone..

examples.japanese: 彼はもう寝たかもしれないけど、一応電話してみようかな。
examples.romaji: kare wa mou neta kamoshirenai kedo, ichiou denwa shite miyou kana.
examples.englishTranslation: He may already be asleep, but I guess I should try to give him a call..

examples.japanese: 一応、明日までに返事をくれる？
examples.romaji: ichiou, ashita made ni henji o kureru.
examples.englishTranslation: Can you at least give me an answer by tomorrow?

examples.japanese: 食事以外には何ができる？
examples.romaji: shokuji igai ni wa nani ga dekiru?
examples.englishTranslation: Apart from eating, what else can we do?

examples.japanese: 彼女以外誰もいない。
examples.romaji: kanojo igai dare mo inai.
examples.englishTranslation: There's no one else but her.

examples.japanese: 水以外何も見えない。
examples.romaji: mizu igai nanimo mienai.
examples.englishTranslation: I don't see anything other than water.

examples.japanese: 彼は英語以外の言語は全く知らない。
examples.romaji: kare wa eigo igai no gengo wa mattaku shiranai.
examples.englishTranslation: He knows no languages other than English.

examples.japanese: 私は彼女以外はみんな好きだ。
examples.romaji: watashi wa kanojo igai wa minna suki da.
examples.englishTranslation: I like everyone aside from her.

title: 以上は(ijou wa) - JLPT N2
titleRomaji: JLPT N2 Grammar ijou ha (ijou wa )

examples.japanese: 約束した以上、きちんと守ってくださいね。
examples.romaji: yakusoku shita ijou, kichinto mamotte kudasai ne.
examples.englishTranslation: You've made a promise, so be sure to keep it!

examples.japanese: 学生である以上、アルバイトではなく勉強が大事ですよ。
examples.romaji: gakusei de aru ijou, arubaito dewa naku benkyou ga daiji desu yo.
examples.englishTranslation: Because you are a student, your studies are more important than your part-time job.

examples.japanese: 給料がこんなに安い以上は、転職を考える人がいるのも当然だ。
examples.romaji: kyuuryou ga konna ni yasui ijou wa, tenshoku o kangaeru hito ga iru no mo touzen da.
examples.englishTranslation: With such low salaries, it's no wonder there are people who want to change jobs.

examples.japanese: お金を払って勉強する以上は、しっかり身につけたい。
examples.romaji: okane o haratte benkyou suru ijou wa, shikkari mi ni tsuketai.
examples.englishTranslation: Since I am paying money to study, I really want to learn.

examples.japanese: 一度やると決めた以上は、最後まで責任を持ってやらないと。
examples.romaji: ichido yaru to kimeta ijou wa, saigo made sekinin o motte yaranai to.
examples.englishTranslation: Once you decide to do something, you must stay responsible until the end.

title: いきなり(ikinari) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: abruptly; suddenly; all of a sudden; without warning

examples.japanese: いきなり男の人に道を聞かれた。
examples.romaji: ikinari otoko no hito ni michi o kikareta.
examples.englishTranslation: A man suddenly asked me for directions.

examples.japanese: いきなりあなたにメールを送ってしまい申し訳ありません。
examples.romaji: ikinari anata ni meeru o okutte shimai moushiwake arimasen.
examples.englishTranslation: I'm sorry for sending you an email suddenly.

examples.japanese: 彼は彼女の手からいきなりハンドバッグを取った。
examples.romaji: kare wa kanojo no te kara ikinari hando baggu o totta.
examples.englishTranslation: He suddenly grabbed her purse from her hand.

examples.japanese: 彼女の兄弟は、いきなり結婚式に現れた。
examples.romaji: kanojo no kyoudai wa, ikinari kekkonshiki ni arawareta.
examples.englishTranslation: Her siblings showed up at the wedding out of the blue.

examples.japanese: 今日は会社に来るとき、私の前でタクシーがいきなり止まってびっくりした。
examples.romaji: kyou wa kaisha ni kuru toki, watashi no mae de takushii ga ikinari tomatte bikkuri shita.
examples.englishTranslation: Today on my way to work, I was surprised by a taxi suddenly stopping right in front of me.

title: 一方で(ippou de) - JLPT N2
titleRomaji: JLPT N2 Grammar ippou de (ippou de )
explanationEN: on one hand, on the other hand; although ~

examples.japanese: お母さんは優しい一方で、お父さんはこわい。
examples.romaji: okaasan wa yasashii ippou de, otousan wa kowai.
examples.englishTranslation: My mother is kind, but on the other hand my father is scary.

examples.japanese: 父は自分に厳しい一方で、他人には優しい。
examples.romaji: chichi wa jibun ni kibishii ippou de, ta’nin niwa yasashii.
examples.englishTranslation: My father is very strict with himself but very kind to others.

examples.japanese: 彼女の仕事は夏は非常に忙しい一方、冬は暇になる。
examples.romaji: kanojo no shigoto wa natsu wa hijou ni isogashii ippou, fuyu wa hima ni naru.
examples.englishTranslation: Her work is very busy in the summer, but on the other hand it is much more relaxed in the winter.

examples.japanese: 彼は俳優である一方で、歌手としても活躍している。
examples.romaji: kare wa haiyuu dearu ippou de, kashu toshite mo katsuyaku shite iru.
examples.englishTranslation: He is an actor, and on the other hand is active as a singer.

examples.japanese: 海外旅行は非日常を体験できることから、楽しいと感じることが多い一方で、不安なこともある。
examples.romaji: kaigai ryokou wa hinichijou o taiken dekiru koto kara, tanoshii to kanjiru koto ga ooi ippou de, fuan na koto mo aru.
examples.englishTranslation: Traveling abroad can be extraordinary, so it's often fun, but on the other hand can be uneasy.

title: いわゆる(iwayuru) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: what is called; as it is called; the so-called; so to speak​

examples.japanese: 彼はいわゆる語学の天才だ。
examples.romaji: kare wa iwayuru gogaku no tensai da.
examples.englishTranslation: He is what is called a genius in language.

examples.japanese: 彼女はいわゆる本の虫です。
examples.romaji: kanojo wa iwayuru hon no mushi desu.
examples.englishTranslation: She is what we call a bookworm.

examples.japanese: 彼女はいわゆる「やり手」だ。
examples.romaji: kanojo wa iwayuru 「yarite」da.
examples.englishTranslation: She is what we call a“go‐getter."

examples.japanese: 彼は何でも知っているから、いわゆる生きる辞書だ。
examples.romaji: kare wa nan demo shitte iru kara, iwayuru ikiru jisho da.
examples.englishTranslation: He knows everything, like a living dictionary.

examples.japanese: 彼女の考えは、いわゆる進歩的なものでした。
examples.romaji: kanojo no kangae wa, iwayuru shinpoteki na mono deshita.
examples.englishTranslation: Her ideas were progressive, so to speak.

examples.japanese: いよいよ大学の生活が始まります。初めて親に離れるからちょっと心配する。
examples.romaji: iyoiyo daigaku no seikatsu ga hajimarimasu. hajimete oya ni hanareru kara chotto shinpai suru.
examples.englishTranslation: My university life has finally begun. Though it is my first time to be away from my parents so I am a little nervous.

examples.japanese: いよいよ来週の日曜日が母の日だ。母に何を買って上げたほうがいいかな。
examples.romaji: iyoiyo raishuu no nichiyoubi ga haha no hi da. haha ni nani o katte ageta hou ga ii kana.
examples.englishTranslation: Mother's day is finally coming up next Sunday. I wonder what should I get for my mom..?

examples.japanese: いよいよスピーチが始まる。どうしよう！めちゃ緊張しているよ。
examples.romaji: iyoiyo supiichi ga hajimaru. dou shiyou! mecha kinchou shiteiru yo.
examples.englishTranslation: The speech is about to start! I'm very nervous!

examples.japanese: いよいよ彼女の出番だ。頑張って練習したからうまく行けるといいね！
examples.romaji: iyoiyo kanojo no deban da. ganbatte renshuu shita karaumaku ikeru to ii ne!
examples.englishTranslation: Finally it's time for her entrance! She worked hard with her practice, so I hope it goes well!

examples.japanese: いよいよ結婚式が目前に迫ってなんとなく落ち着かない。
examples.romaji: iyoiyo kekkonshiki ga mokuzen ni sematte nantonaku ochitsukanai.
examples.englishTranslation: Now that our wedding ceremony is just around the corner, we can't seem to calm down.

title: 上(jou) - JLPT N2
explanationEN: for the sake of; from the standpoint of; as a matter of; in terms of ~

examples.japanese: 健康上ではポテトフライや揚げ物などは食べない方がいいと思います。
examples.romaji: kenkou jou de wa poteto furai ya agemono nado wa tabenai hou ga ii to omoi masu.
examples.englishTranslation: For the sake of one's health, I think it's best to not eat french fries or other fried foods.

examples.japanese: 日本の法律上はお酒を飲んで車を運転するのは禁止です。
examples.romaji: nihon no houritsu jou wa osake o nonde kuruma o unten suru no wa kinshi desu.
examples.englishTranslation: In terms of Japanese law, it is illegal to drink and drive.

examples.japanese: 理論上はこれが可能だが、実用化には時間がかかりそうだ。
examples.romaji: riron jou wa kore ga kanou da ga, jitsuyouka ni wa jikan ga kakari sou da.
examples.englishTranslation: In theory this is possible, but to actually implement it looks like it will take some time.

examples.japanese: 彼女は健康上の理由で仕事を辞めたそうです。
examples.romaji: kanojo wakenkou jou no riyuu de shigoto o yameta sou desu.
examples.englishTranslation: She apparently quit her job for the sake of her health.

examples.japanese: 会社の規則上は作業中にヘルメットを必ず被ることです。
examples.romaji: kaisha no kisoku jou wa sagyouchuu ni herumetto o kanarazu kaburu koto desu.
examples.englishTranslation: In accordance with the company rules, one must always wear their helmet during work.

title: かのように(ka no you ni) - JLPT N2
titleRomaji: JLPT N2 Grammar kanoyouni (ka no you ni )

examples.japanese: 怖いものを見たかのように、彼女は震えた。
examples.romaji: kowai mono o mita ka no you ni, kanojo wa furueta.
examples.englishTranslation: She was shaking as if she saw something scary.

examples.japanese: 友達は自分が合格したかのように喜んでくれた。
examples.romaji: tomodachi wa jibun ga goukaku shita ka no youni yorokonde kureta.
examples.englishTranslation: My friend was so happy for me as if they had passed (the test) themself.

examples.japanese: 彼は今日初めて会うのに、前に何度も会ったことがあるかのような態度で話してくる。
examples.romaji: kare wa kyou hajimete au noni, mae ni nando mo atta koto ga aru ka no youna taido de hanashite kuru.
examples.englishTranslation: Although this is the first time I am meeting him, he spoke to me as if we had met many times before.

examples.japanese: Instagramでたくさんの人にフォロワーされると、まるで有名人になったかのようだ。
examples.romaji: Instagram de takusan no hito ni forowaa sareru to, marude yuumeijin ni natta ka no you da.
examples.englishTranslation: I'm followed by a lot of people on Instagram, it's almost as if I am a celebrity.

examples.japanese: あの二人は姉妹であるかのようだが、実は親子です。
examples.romaji: ano futari wa shimai de aru ka no you da ga, jitsu wa oyako desu.
examples.englishTranslation: Those two may seem like they are sisters, but they are actually mother and daughter.

title: かと思ったら(ka to omottara) - JLPT N2
titleRomaji: JLPT N2 Grammar kato omotta ra (ka to omottara )

examples.japanese: 空が急に暗くなってきたかと思うと、雨が降ってきた。
examples.romaji: sora ga kyuu ni kuraku natte kita ka to omou to, ame ga futte kita.
examples.englishTranslation: No sooner had the sky turned dark, when it started to rain.

examples.japanese: 娘が帰って来たかと思うと、すぐに家を出ていった。
examples.romaji: musume ga kaette kita ka to omou to, sugu ni ie o deteitta.
examples.englishTranslation: Just as my daughter returned home, she was out the door again.

examples.japanese: うちの近くの公園の花が咲いたかと思ったら、もう散ってしまった。
examples.romaji: uchi no chikaku no kouen no hana ga saita ka to omottara, mou chitte shimatta.
examples.englishTranslation: No sooner than the flowers were starting to bloom at our nearby park, the pedals had fallen.

examples.japanese: 息子が勉強を始めたかと思ったら、リビングでドラマを見ている。
examples.romaji: musuko ga benkyou o hajimeta ka to omottara, ribingu de dorama o mite iru.
examples.englishTranslation: No sooner than my son had started studying, he was already in the living room watching TV.

examples.japanese: 彼は食事を始めたかと思ったら寝てしまった。
examples.romaji: kare wa shokuji o hajimeta ka to omottara nete shimatta.
examples.englishTranslation: Just when he thought he would start eating he fell asleep.
